intro: Chrysaspis campestris, commonly known as the field chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Chrysaspis campestris is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and ease of cultivation.
